content:
Dear Zipporah,

I hope this letter finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to thank you for being such a dedicated student and confidant. Your enthusiasm and dedication to learning and growing have truly been an inspiration to me, and I am so grateful to have you as a part of my life and work.

As you know, my work as a hypnotist and NLP practitioner involves helping people to overcome challenges and achieve their goals through powerful, innovative techniques. I have been fortunate enough to be able to share these techniques with people all around the world, and it has been an incredible journey for me.

I am also very grateful to have been able to study with and learn from some of the most influential figures in my field, such as Robert Anton Wilson, Richard Bandler, and Terrence McKenna. Their wisdom and teachings have had a profound impact on my work and my worldview, and I am grateful to have been able to carry their legacy forward in my own way.

I am particularly grateful to have been able to learn from and work with Terrence McKenna, as his insights on the use of marijuana as a spiritual ally have been particularly influential for me. I believe that this plant has the power to elevate consciousness and facilitate deep healing and growth, and I have been blessed to be able to share this understanding with others through my work.

I am also grateful for the opportunity to share my trance-induction techniques with others. I have found that these techniques have the power to bring people to a place of deep healing and transformation, and the long-term benefits of this work can be truly life-changing.

I am grateful to have you as a student and confidant, and I hope that my work has been able to have a positive impact on your life as well. If there is anything I can do to continue to support you on your journey, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Warmly,
Phil Farber
